How does religion help explain man’s existence? It doesn’t. Human’s existence explain the existence of religion. As a child does, so did humanity learn to crawl, stand and walk, talk and think. In that order. But in that process, it had phases where its cognition (recognition/discrimination/seeing patterns) would be ahead of its ability to understand them. This is when, like children humanity called animism. Infering that which you can investigate and gives you the possibility to investigate, without you knowing it is so: your own mind. In that sense, humanity did what children do: They think all things around them have the same properties as they themselves have. That is how religion came to be in short, always shifting goalposts.

It’s clear that many religious claims are just bald-ass assertions without any confirming evidence to back them up. Not only do they contradict the world we live in—but they often conflict with other religious claims—sometimes even in the same religion. There seem to be people who are satisfied with a “god did it” answer. But really it may be an answer to a lot of questions—-but it’s never an honest answer—and it’s certainly not an explanation. An explanation is supposed to make the answer clearer—not more mysterious. “God did it” is just as satisfying as, “It’s magic!” Which is to say—it’s not a satisfactory response.
